html:
To help you anticipate and navigate all that television has to offer across broadcast, cable and streaming, TVLine offers daily, weekly and monthly What to Watch digests, as well as an overview of every new TV show premiering in 2025.

This week, youâ€™ll find 15 series premieres (including The Institute and Untamed), 11 returning series (including The Summer I Turned Pretty and Star Trek: Strange New Worlds) and 10 finales (including Love Island: USA and RuPaulâ€™s Drag Race All Stars).

Want scoop on any of the following shows? Email usÂ and your question may be answered in Mattâ€™s Inside Line.

SUNDAY, JULY 13

ğŸ“º 4 pm WWE: Evolution (Peacock live event)
ğŸ“º 8 pm Naked and Afraid: Last One Standing Season 3 finale (Discovery Channel)
ğŸ“º 9 pm Evil Lives Here Season 18 (Investigation Discovery)

ğŸ“º 9 pm The Institute (MGM+)
Mary-Louise Parker and Ben Barnes lead the series adaptation of Stephen Kingâ€™s 2019 novel.

ğŸ“º 9 pm Kings Court (Bravo)
Supermodel Tyson Beckford, NBA All-Star Carlos Boozer and WWE legend Thaddeus â€œTitus Oâ€™Neilâ€ Bullard search for their queen among 21 smart, accomplished and beautiful ladies.

ğŸ“º 9 pm Live Aid: When Rock â€™nâ€™ Roll Took On the World (CNN)
The four-part docuseries commemorates the 40th anniversary of Live Aid, and features rare archival performance and backstage footage with Paula Yates, Boy George, Status Quo and George Michael.Â 

ğŸ“º 9 pm Love Island: Beyond the Villa (Peacock)
The spinoff follows Season 6 Islanders around Los Angeles as they navigate new careers, evolving friendships, newfound fame and complex relationships. (Subsequent episodes drop Thursdays at 9/8c.)

ğŸ“º 9 pm Love Island: USA Season 7 finale (Peacock)

ğŸ“º 10 pm Billionaire Boys Club (CNN)
The docuseriesÂ unpacks the rise and fall of Joe Hunt, and the exclusive investment group comprised of privileged 20-somethings whose schemes and crimes captivated the media.

ğŸ¥ 9 pm Southpaw: The Life and Legacy of Jim Abbott (ESPN documentary)
The E60 film chronicles the story of the former major league pitcher who was born without a right hand but pitched a no-hitter for the New York Yankees in 1993.

MONDAY, JULY 14

âš¾ï¸ 8 pm MLB Home Run Derby (ESPN)

ğŸ“º 10 pm A Killer Among Friends (Investigation Discovery)
A group of interconnected individuals who are collectively haunted by a murder of one of their own; Jennifer Love Hewitt narrates.

ğŸ“º 10 pm Life After People Season 3 (History)
ğŸ“º 10 pm The 6000 lb Diaries With Dr. Now Season 1 finale (Lifetime)

TUESDAY, JULY 15

ğŸ“º Her Last Broadcast: The Abduction of Jodi Huisentruit (Hulu, three-episode binge)
Thirty years after the TV news anchor disappeared from her Iowa apartment just before dawn, the lead detective identifies new persons of interest.

âš¾ï¸ 8 pm MLB All-Star Game (Fox)
ğŸ“º 9 pm Road Wars Season 5 (A&E)
ğŸ“º 10 pm Customer Wars Season 6 (A&E)
ğŸ“º 10 pm Down Home Fab Season 3 finale (HGTV)

WEDNESDAY, JULY 16

ğŸ“º Amy Bradley Is Missing (Netflix, three-episode binge)
This true-crime docuseries investigates the 1998 disappearance of a 23-year-old woman from a Caribbean cruise and her familyâ€™s tireless search for answers.

ğŸ“º Miley Cyrus: Something Beautiful (Disney+ and Hulu special)
Cyrus delivers a one-of-a-kind pop opera fueled by fantasy, featuring 13 new songs from the visual album, Something Beautiful.

ğŸ“º The Summer I Turned Pretty final season (Prime Video, two-episode premiere)
ğŸ† 8 pm The ESPY Awards (ABC)
ğŸ“º 8 pm Outrageous Season 1 finale (BritBox)
ğŸ“º 8 pm Sullivanâ€™s Crossing Season 3 finale (The CW)
ğŸ“º 9 pm Sistas Season 9 (BET)

THURSDAY, JULY 17

ğŸ“º Disneyland Resort P.O.V. Walkthroughs (Disney+, 16-episode binge)
Immersive P.O.V. experiences transport you straight through cinematic ride-alongs on iconic Disneyland attractions.

ğŸ“º The Furry Detectives: Unmasking a Monster (Sundance Now, four-episode binge)
The gripping docuseries reveals a chilling secret that lies beneath the colorful world of Furry.

ğŸ“º Heartland Season 18 finale (UP Faith & Family)
ğŸ“º House on Fire Season 1 finale (BET+)
ğŸ“º Star Trek: Strange New Worlds Season 3 (Paramount+, two-episode premiere)

ğŸ“º Surf Girls: International (Prime Video, five-episode binge)
The offshoot follows five up-and-coming female surfers representing their home countries as they travel the world competing in the Challenger Series.Â 

ğŸ“º Untamed (Netflix, six-episode binge)
A special agent (Eric Bana) for the National Parks Service investigates a brutal death that sends him on a collision course with dark secrets from his past.

ğŸ“º 9 pm Family Recipe Showdown (Food Network, two-episode premiere)
Each episode welcomes family duos to the kitchen as they prepare their most cherished recipes for a $10,000 prize; Octavia Spencer hosts.

ğŸ“º 9 pm Homicide Squad New Orleans Season 2 (A&E)

ğŸ¥ The Amateur (Hulu)

FRIDAY, JULY 18

ğŸ“º RuPaulâ€™s Drag Race All Stars Season 10 finale (Paramount+)
ğŸ“º RuPaulâ€™s Drag Race All Stars: Untucked Season 6 finale (Paramount+)

ğŸ“º 8 pm Billy Joel: And So It Goes (HBO)
The two-week docuseries event offers an expansive portrait of the life and music of Billy Joel, exploring the love, loss and personal struggles that fuel his songwriting.

ğŸ“º 8 pm The Fixer (Fox, next day on Hulu)
Business investor/entrepreneurÂ Marcus Lemonis puts his money to work and uses his signature 3 Pâ€™s philosophy â€” People, Process, and Product â€” to empower businesses to thrive.

ğŸ“º 9 pm My Lottery Dream Home Season 18 (HGTV)

ğŸ¤£ Zarna Garg: Practical People Win (Hulu comedy special)

ğŸ¥ TKO (Tubi movie)
After reuniting with his estranged sons, a former boxer (Robert Riâ€™chard) must step up as a father and a coach when his oldest begins competing in professional boxing.

ğŸ¥ I Love You Forever (Max)

SATURDAY, JULY 19

ğŸ“º 8 pm Love & Marriage: Huntsville Season 10 (OWN)
ğŸ€ 8:30 pm WNBA All-Star Game (ABC)

ğŸ¥ The Assessment (Hulu)

ğŸ¥ 8 pm Faith in the Flames: The Nichole Jolly Story (Lifetime movie)
Chrissy Metz plays the titular, heroic nurse who helped residents of Paradise, Calif. during a devastating 2018 fire.

What are you watching this week? Take stock of everything above, then drop a comment with your lists below.
